title: In A One-Room Schoolhouse, Irish Family Keeps Legacy Of W.B. Yeats Alive
teaser: The poet W.B. Yeats was born 150 years ago this week. In rural Ireland, a nun whose family has a personal history with the poet has turned a one-room schoolhouse into a small Yeats museum.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
